Consistency is hard when your ADHD brain doesn't produce enough dopamine and distracting thoughts ruin your attempts to get things done. Follow these 6 Steps to improve the likelihood of staying on track:
1. Purge 2. Simplify 3. Set-Up 4. Predict Consequences 5. Visual Reminders 6. Seek Inspiration *Bonus: Be Realistic

entry.title: üíä Should You Take ADHD Medications & Are They Safe? ‚öïÔ∏è

media:group.media:title: üíä Should You Take ADHD Medications & Are They Safe? ‚öïÔ∏è
media:group.media:description:
Get ADHD Coaching with me ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.adhd-management.com/coaching How to get a Diagnosis ‚û°Ô∏è https://youtu.be/dtNYMHXsE6s Join this channel to get access to perks ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWGinC3N-74gAxM1pb8zQiw/join
Please note I am not a medical professional.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/adhdmanager Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/adhdmanagement
Deciding whether to take ADHD Medications can be hard, and even harder to find the sweet spot that works for you. It can be even harder if you're a parent debating the ethics of medicating your kids. It's mostly shown that in adequate doses, meds can really transform someone's life. But it is not unheard of that they can cause unpleasant side-effects and in small numbers, mental health issues.
Sources:
Videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NdXlfC-_nlY (IHealthTube) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nTPSNYZIYyQ (Jordan Peterson) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6j1xCJc2ZAA (Robert Whitaker) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t8EgQqK9I8Y (ADHD & Risk of Adult Drug Use) https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=10&v=uju0J92eaqI&feature=emb_title (More Study Sources)
Studies: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12509574 (Does stimulant therapy of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder beget later substance abuse?)
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2821235/ (Growth in Children)
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25726514 (Mortality Rates in ADHD)
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23165220 (MR imaging of the effects of methylphenidate on brain structure and function in attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder.)
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3801446/ (Effect of Psychostimulants on Brain Structure and Function in ADHD)
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12365958 (Developmental trajectories of brain volume abnormalities in children and adolescents with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder.)
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1363724/ (Influence of methylphenidate on brain development ‚Äì an update of recent animal experiments) https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3272832/ (Large-Scale Brain Systems in ADHD: Beyond the Prefrontal-Striatal Model)

media:group.media:description:
Get ADHD Coaching with me ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.adhd-management.com/coaching How to get a Diagnosis ‚û°Ô∏è https://youtu.be/dtNYMHXsE6s Join this channel to get access to perks ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWGinC3N-74gAxM1pb8zQiw/join
Please note I am not a medical professional.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/adhdmanager Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/adhdmanagement
My advice comes from first-hand experience as an ADHD person myself. Using visual progression tracking and goal prioritisation methods, you can develop a useful strategy to override your weaknesses as a person with ADHD.
Step 1: Get to know yourself (How do you normally get things done?) Step 2: Be Kind to yourself (Be realistic and stop pushing yourself so hard) Step 3: Break down End-Goals into small, easier achievements to avoid overwhelm Step 4: Compare your current position to your past position: Where are you now?
#AdhdSuccess #AdhdManagement #Organisation

entry.title: üéÇ 3 Years On Concerta! üíä An Overview

media:group.media:title: üéÇ 3 Years On Concerta! üíä An Overview
media:group.media:description:
Get ADHD Coaching with me ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.adhd-management.com/coaching How to get a Diagnosis ‚û°Ô∏è https://youtu.be/dtNYMHXsE6s Join this channel to get access to perks ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWGinC3N-74gAxM1pb8zQiw/join
Please note I am not a medical professional.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/adhdmanager Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/adhdmanagement __________________________________________________________________________________________________
*Side Effects*
*Common (may affect up to 1 in 10 people):* Headache, Joint pain, Blurred vision, Tension headache, Dry mouth, Thirst, Trouble falling asleep, High temperature (fever), Reduced libido, Unusual hair loss or thinning, Muscle tightness, Muscle cramps, Loss of appetite or decreased appetite, Inability to develop or maintain an erection, Itching, Rash or raised red itchy rashes (hives), Feeling unusually sleepy, drowsy or tired, Clenching to grinding teeth, Feeling of panic, Tingling feeling, prickling, or numbness of the skin, Cough, Sore throat, Upper respiratory tract infection, Sinus infection, High blood pressure, Fast heartbeat (tachycardia), Dizziness (vertigo), Feeling weak, Movements which you cannot control, Feeling aggressive, agitated, anxious, depressed, irritable, tense, or jittery, Upset stomach or indigestion, Stomach pain, Diarrhoea, Feeling sick, Stomach discomfort and being sick.
*Uncommon (may affect up to 1 in 100 people):* Dry eyes, Constipation, Chest discomfort, Blood in the urine, Listlessness, Shaking or trembling, Increased need to pass urine, Muscle pain, Muscle twitching, Shortness of breath or chest pain, Feeling hot, Anger, Feeling restless or tearful, Talking too much, Excessive awareness of surroundings, Problems sleeping.
*Rare (may affect up to 1 in 1,000 people):* Feeling disoriented, Confusion, Trouble seeing or double vision, Swelling of the breast tissue in men, Excessive sweating, Redness of the skin, Red raised skin rash.
*Very Rare (may affect up to 1 in 10,000 people):* Muscle cramps, Small red marks on the skin, Abnormal liver function including liver failure and coma, Changes in test results-including liver and blood tests, Abnormal thinking, Lack of feeling emotion, Doing things over and over again, being obsessed with one thing, Temporary low mood, Fingers and toes feeling numb, tingling and changing colour.
*Effects on Growth:* When used for more than a year. methylphenidate may cause reduced growth in some children. This affects less than 1 in 10 children: There may be a lack of weight gain or height growth Your doctor will carefully watch your child's height and weight as well as how well they are eating.
*Alcohol:* Do not take this medication with alcohol as it may increase or worsen unwanted side-effects.
____________________________________________________________________
#LivingWithADHD #ConcertaReview #AdhdMedication

Not all cases are easy to diagnose because many people with ADHD don't display traits of hyperactivity, which can leave many left behind and ruled out. Please note I am not a medical professional.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/adhdmanager Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/adhdmanagement
A look into why people with ADD/ADHD experience such a struggle with motivating themselves and possible ways around it. Just to clarify, a lack of motivation in ADHD is driven by two aspects:
1. The brain's difficulty in producing enough dopamine on a regular basis that leads to feelings of emotional engagement, interest and reward.
2. Your attitude and level of self-belief formed by your experiences of living with your ADHD.
#AdhdMotivation #AdhdManagement

entry.title: üß† ADHD Brain Fog ‚òÅÔ∏è 3 Possible Diet Solutions

media:group.media:title: üß† ADHD Brain Fog ‚òÅÔ∏è 3 Possible Diet Solutions
media:group.media:description:
Get ADHD Coaching with me ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.adhd-management.com/coaching How to get a Diagnosis ‚û°Ô∏è https://youtu.be/dtNYMHXsE6s Join this channel to get access to perks ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWGinC3N-74gAxM1pb8zQiw/join
Please note I am not a medical professional.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/adhdmanager Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/adhdmanagement
A Low-Carb/Keto Diet, Intermittent Fasting and Fasted Workouts can help alleviate symptoms of Brain Fog, especially If you suffer from ADD or ADHD. You may be aware of the term 'Brain Fog' to describe the feeling of having a clouded mind, feeling lost in a mental haze of muddled thoughts and low mental energy. We forget that medication alone will only take you so far and that much of our productivity comes from what energy sources we consume and how well we condition our bodies. Lifestyle options for improving cognitive function in ADHD brains may greatly reduce the occurrence of Brain Fog overall.
#AdhdBrainFog #AdhdManagement #AdhdDiet

media:group.media:description:
Get ADHD Coaching with me ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.adhd-management.com/coaching How to get a Diagnosis ‚û°Ô∏è https://youtu.be/dtNYMHXsE6s Join this channel to get access to perks ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWGinC3N-74gAxM1pb8zQiw/join
Please note I am not a medical professional.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/adhdmanager Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/adhdmanagement
My experience using Strattera (Atomoxetine) for treating ADHD. Classified as an 'SNRI' (Selective Norepinephrine Reuptake Inhibitor) drug, this non-stimulant medication is an alternative option to consider. As with all medications, there's potentially good results and potentially bad side effects. Don't let any negative aspects of this video put you off Strattera, as everyone responds differently. Only when you try it out for yourself will you know if it's right for you. If you're interested in giving Strattera a trial run, you should consult a psychiatrist.
#Strattera #Atomoxetine #Adhd

*Disclaimer* Make sure you discuss how to take your medication with your doctor before implementing anything I say in this video. Methylphenidate (Often known as Concerta) used to treat ADD/ADHD can possibly cause troublesome effects when over-used and equally when abruptly ending long-term daily usage. Be sure to exercise moderation and be smart about using this powerful stimulant to avoid 'chasing highs', feeling lousy and burnout.
